document.discussion_title: Anne Arundel has the edge against Howard in boys lacrosse
document.topic_text: Anne Arundel has the edge against Howard in boys lacrosse Severna Park vs. Mt. Hebron boys lacrosse highlights Watch highlights from Severna Park's 6-4 victory over Mt. Hebron on April 6, 2016. (Tim Schwartz/Howard County Times video) Watch highlights from Severna Park's 6-4 victory over Mt. Hebron on April 6, 2016. (Tim Schwartz/Howard County Times video) Glenn Graham The Baltimore Sun Anne Arundel County flexing its muscles against Howard County in boys lacrosse. So far this boys lacrosse season, Anne Arundel County has impressively had the better of things against their Howard counterparts. The two counties came together for a season-long mixer with games against each other every week. Last week, Anne Arundel claimed five of the six games against Howard competition. On Tuesday, most notably South River beat then-No. 14 Mount Hebron, No. 8 Broadneck handled Glenelg, and No. 9 Severna Park took care of Howard. On the season, Anne Arundel is 12-6 and its top two teams -- Broadneck and Severna Park -- have dominated some of Howard's finest. The Bruins (9-0) are 3-0 with wins over Howard, Glenelg and Marriotts Ridge. The Falcons (8-2) beat Howard, Mount Hebron and Glenelg. North County also is 3-0 against Howard competition. The series resumes this afternoon when Mount Hebron visits Arundel and continues with more games on Wednesday.
